alert.note: Alert for Cotton (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 07 at 12:53PM CST until December 10 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Deep Red Creek near Randlett affecting Cotton County.
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC033-080700- /O.NEW.KOUN.FL.Y.0027.221207T1853Z-221210T0600Z/ /RNDO2.N.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 1253 PM CST Wed Dec 7 2022 ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Deep Red Creek near Randlett. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Some inundation of bottomlands may occur along and near the creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 2.6 feet. - Forecast...The Deep Red Creek is expected to rise to a crest of 17.5 feet early Friday afternoon. - Action stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
